questions.question: Rewrite the sentence in passive voice: 'The cat ate the mouse.'
options: The mouse was eaten by the cat.
The cat is eating the mouse.
questions.correctAnswer: The mouse was eaten by the cat.
questions.explanation: In passive voice, the object of the action becomes the subject of the sentence.

questions.question: Rewrite the sentence in passive voice: 'The chef cooked a delicious meal.'
options: A delicious meal was cooked by the chef.
The chef is cooking a delicious meal.
A delicious meal cooks the chef.
The chef cooks a delicious meal.
questions.correctAnswer: A delicious meal was cooked by the chef.
questions.explanation: In passive voice, the focus is on the meal rather than the chef.

questions.question: Rewrite the sentence in passive voice: 'The teacher explains the lesson.'
options: The lesson is explained by the teacher.
The teacher is explained by the lesson.
questions.correctAnswer: The lesson is explained by the teacher.
questions.explanation: In passive voice, the object of the action becomes the subject of the sentence.

questions.question: Rewrite the sentence in passive voice: 'The committee will approve the new policy.'
options: The new policy will be approved by the committee.
The new policy approves the committee.
The committee approves the new policy.
The committee is approving the new policy.
questions.correctAnswer: The new policy will be approved by the committee.
questions.explanation: In passive voice, the object of the action becomes the subject of the sentence.

questions.question: Rewrite the sentence in passive voice: 'They had completed the project before the deadline.'
options: The project had been completed by them before the deadline.
They had been completed by the project before the deadline.
The project had completed them before the deadline.
The deadline had completed the project before them.
questions.correctAnswer: The project had been completed by them before the deadline.
questions.explanation: In passive voice, the focus is on the project rather than the people.

questions.question: Rewrite the sentence in passive voice: 'The scientist discovered a new element in the lab.'
options: A new element was discovered by the scientist in the lab.
A new element discovered the scientist in the lab.
The scientist was discovered by a new element in the lab.
In the lab, a new element was discovered by the scientist.
questions.correctAnswer: A new element was discovered by the scientist in the lab.
questions.explanation: In passive voice, the focus is on the element rather than the scientist.

questions.question: Rewrite the sentence in passive voice: 'The government is implementing new policies to combat climate change.'
options: New policies to combat climate change are being implemented by the government.
New policies are implementing the government to combat climate change.
The government to combat climate change is being implemented by new policies.
Climate change is being combated by new policies implemented by the government.
questions.correctAnswer: New policies to combat climate change are being implemented by the government.
questions.explanation: In passive voice, the focus is on the policies rather than the government.

questions.question: Choose the correct form of the verb: 'He _____ (go) to the store.'
questions.explanation: The present perfect tense is used to describe an action that occurred at an unspecified time and has relevance to the present.

questions.question: Complete the sentence: 'They _____ (see) this movie before.'
questions.explanation: Present perfect tense is used to indicate that an action has been completed before another point in time.

questions.explanation: Present perfect tense is used to describe an experience at an unspecified time.

questions.question: Complete the sentence: 'He _____ (live) in five different countries.'
questions.explanation: Present perfect tense is used to describe an action that occurred at an unspecified time and has relevance to the present.

questions.question: Complete the sentence: 'By next year, I _____ (graduate) from college.'
questions.explanation: Future perfect tense is used to describe an action that will be completed before a specific point in the future.

questions.question: Choose the correct form of the verb: 'She _____ (finish) her work by the time you arrive.'
questions.explanation: Future perfect tense is used to describe an action that will be completed before a specific point in the future.

questions.question: Unscramble the word: 'GOD'
questions.explanation: The correct unscrambled word is 'DOG'.

questions.question: Fill in the blank: 'She is going _____ the store.'
questions.explanation: The correct preposition is 'to'.

questions.question: Fill in the blank: 'He sat _____ the chair.'
questions.explanation: The correct preposition is 'on'.

questions.question: Fill in the blank: 'The book is _____ the table.'
questions.explanation: The correct preposition is 'on'.

questions.question: Fill in the blank: 'She is interested _____ learning new languages.'
questions.explanation: The correct preposition is 'in'.

questions.question: Fill in the blank: 'He is good _____ playing the piano.'
questions.explanation: The correct preposition is 'at'.

questions.question: Fill in the blank: 'She arrived _____ the airport an hour early.'
questions.explanation: The correct preposition is 'at'.
